programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull are in Swindon to transform a troublesome sloping plot with a rotten deck into a 21st-century cottage garden perfect for entertaining friends

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team visits busy mum Monique at her two-bedroom home in South East London. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, the team create special bunkbed spaces for her two daughters, address the overspill of toys with bespoke storage solutions, and give their bathroom a deep clean

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Ria Lina on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda struggles with the Knight family invasion on the Vic and George speaks to Phil about a collaboration with the Boxing Den. Ben reveals his plan to sell the Arches but Phil is not impressed when he finds out the potential buyer is Sharon. Things are tense with the Panesars and Eve and Suki find their chance to get rid of Nish for good

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway is in Dinas Powys, just outside Cardiff, to walk the five-mile Salmon Leaps circular trail. The route takes him through ancient woodland and across the historical Cwrt yr Ala estate before he returns to Dinas Powys where the Village Show is in full swing. Wildlife expert Lizzie Daly goes in search of night creatures and Onkar Singh Purewal joins a dawn swim at Penarth

programme.title: How Did Our Sons Become Killers?
programme.desc: The mothers of boys who killed people share their feelings, and reflect on how their personal experiences might help others to prevent further deaths in the future. One woman describes the moment she realised her son had attacked a stranger, while another says she's now forgiven her mentally ill son for stabbing her and killing his father

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: Leah has spent almost two months nursing a patient from the same farming community as her recover after surgery. It's a sad but proud moment when he's finally well enough to leave. Despite trying to stay out of trouble, nurse Mikey faces all the ward banter as suspect number one when a vital medicine machine malfunctions. Meanwhile, Caitlin faces her first shift in Resus as a qualified nurse. She holds her own well, but has a patient whose case illustrates just how fast things can take a turn in A&E

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz with Hugh Dennis and Ruth Davidson joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs' skills are tested to the limits when they work in teams to produce digital looks for Adidas at Metaverse Fashion Week, where they must impress guest judge Isamaya Ffrench. Back in the studio they're tasked with producing cartoon characters that live in a made-up world, with one of the contestants eliminated at the end of the challenge

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Ravinder Bhogal and Georgina Hayden, plus special guest Dan Aykroyd. Olly Smith chooses the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Mary Berry - Love to Cook
programme.desc: Mary cooks four recipes that prove watching the pennies does not mean having to sacrifice on flavour. They include a crab courgetti spaghetti dish that uses tinned fish at a fraction of the cost of fresh. Plus, a spinach filo swirl demonstrates an inventive way of stretching six sausages to feed the family

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to today's FA Cup final between Manchester City and Manchester United at Wembley Stadium

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: A reimagined look back at the 2022/23 season's gripping FA Cup journey through a homage to classic video games

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: Sportscene Live
programme.desc: Celtic v Inverness Caledonian Thistle (Kick-off 5.30pm). All the action from the Scottish Cup final at Hampden Park. The last of treble-chasing Celtic's record 40 triumphs in this competition came in 2020, when they defeated Hearts on penalties, while the only time Caley have lifted the trophy was in 2015, when they overcame Falkirk

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Iain is called out to a multi-vehicle crash caused by a man jumping from a bridge. The crisis forces him to relive traumatic memories of the events that led to his partner's death, and makes him question his relationship with a still struggling Faith. Jodie comes to see a different side to her father, Cam finds himself lodging with unexpected company, and Paige receives some troubling news

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc: A scientist's body is found in Loch Katrine, a case that reminds Annika of a play by Ibsen. But with so many people wanting the victim dead, which one did he push over the edge? Away from work, the DI takes more than a parental interest in Morgan's therapist. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Lionel Messi: Destiny
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes documentary looking at how the Argentina star, won the World Cup for the first time in his illustrious career last year in Qatar. With contributions from his international teammates, including Premier League stars Emi Martinez, Alexix Mac Allister and Julian Alvarez, and manager Lionel Scaloni

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Celtic v Inverness Caledonian Thistle. Jonathan Sutherland presents highlights of the showpiece match, held at Hampden Park

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United. Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the final between the rivals, which came from Wembley Stadium. With analysis from Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United. Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the final between the rivals, which came from Wembley Stadium. With analysis from Jermaine Jenas

programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Walks of Life
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig follows in the footsteps of Charles Dickens as she explores the Kent countryside, visiting the setting of Great Expectations and the house where the author died

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Three treasured family heirlooms are brought back to life, featuring a badly damaged suspended chair from the 1960s, a cast iron statue of Roman god Hercules, and a smokers' stand

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from the Kent County Showground in Detling, and finds out about local explorer Julius Brenchley. With experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley celebrates the 25th anniversary of the Angel of the North, joined by the statue's creator Antony Gormley and the former Bishop of Jarrow

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple from Hertfordshire to find a new home in their favourite holiday destination of Cornwall, as well as meeting a local ceramicist

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc: Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. But seeing a carefree and integrated Annie only makes Terry feel like more of an outsider and his PTSD spirals. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously-planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Arsenal goalkeeper Jens Lehmann, British gymnastics great Beth Tweddle, seven-time snooker world champion Stephen Hendry and BBC sports presenter JJ Chalmers join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Iorram - Boat Song
programme.desc: A cinema documentary entirely in Scottish Gaelic, Iorram (Boat Song) is a lyrical portrait of life in Scotland's Outer Hebrides, past and present. Director Alastair Cole takes the audience on an immersive journey into the heart and soul of a 1000-year-old community, blending archive sound recordings of voices from the past with visuals of island life today and an original score by acclaimed folk musician Aidan O'Rourke. At the core of the film is an extraordinary trove of sound archive, recorded by pioneering Scottish ethnographers in the mid-20th century, who visited the Western Isles to capture the hardship and romance of life lived in precarious balance with the sea. These newly restored recordings preserve an oral history of lore and legends, tall tales and tragedies, passed down through generations of Gaelic speakers. This soundtrack of voices, stories and songs from the past is accompanied by moving imagery of the daily working rhythm of the islands, on land and on water, shot ov

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern is in Eastbourne, where he plays Mum's the Word, the Leaning Tower of Poundsa and brand-new game Escalator Spectator, before finishing the series with one last round of In for a Penny

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)
programme.desc: While on leave, James Bond prevents a young woman - Teresa 'Tracy' Draco - from committing suicide. Her father is Marc-Ange Draco, the head of a powerful crime syndicate who is impressed by Bond and wants him to protect his daughter by marrying her. In exchange, he offers Bond information that will lead him to master criminal and arch-enemy Ernst Stavro Blofeld, who is intent on destroying world peace by means of a lethal virus unless he receives an international amnesty for his crimes. Spy adventure, starring George Lazenby in his only outing as 007, alongside Telly Savalas, Diana Rigg, Gabriele Ferzetti and Bernard Lee

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Sitting on a Fortune
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Gary Lineker in which contestants Stuart, Kate, Jaimi, Mark, Durelle and Amun answer questions to remain in with a chance of taking away up to £100,000. Players position themselves in a row of seats one behind another, with one wrong answer seeing them relegated to the back of the line and in real danger of leaving with nothing

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec return to host the grand finale of the talent search, while Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli form the judging panel. Taking to stage are the acts who secured the judges' and public votes across the semi-finals, but the public vote alone determines the outcome of the final, where the chosen favourite will be named the winner of Britain's Got Talent 2023. As always, the victor will also be leaving the competition with the life-changing £250,000 cash prize and a coveted place at the Royal Variety Performance

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Run All Night (2015)
programme.desc: A hitman working for a longtime friend who has become head of a crime syndicate becomes disillusioned with his life and haunted by his past misdeeds. He is forced to turn against the syndicate and place himself in the firing line when he learns a hit has been ordered on his own estranged son. Director Jaume Collet-Serra's action thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Ed Harris, Joel Kinnaman and Boyd Holbrook

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Jordan, Claire, Chris and Natasha pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Preparations are underway for the big wedding. Caleb can see the finish line. Sarah is worried by what Chloe has planned

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Daisy anxiously awaits the jury's verdict on Justin, Max admits to David that he cannot face returning home, and Aggie and Ed are forced to dine with their former neighbours

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: Martin Clunes: Islands of America
programme.desc: The actor travels around the coast of the United States to discover what life is like on the surrounding islands. He sets off on a 10,000-mile journey from the west to the east, to explore the vast swathe of islands that are scattered beyond America's shores. The first port of call on his journey is Hawaii, and his exploration looks beyond its image as a tourist paradise, crammed with sun-kissed beaches and world-class surfing, and into the havoc wreaked by advancing lava fields and smoking craters. Leaving Hawaii, Martin flies 2,500 miles north to the islands of Alaska, where the contrast couldn't be more extreme, from tropical rain forests to snow-fringed glaciers, and from crowded beaches to some of America's most sparsely populated territories

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott presents the first of two visits to Antigua, where he gets masterclasses in cocktail mixing and playing steel pans, meeting the leader of one of the island's first steel pan bands. He also gets a taste of a Caribbean specialty from the owner of a roadside food stall and mixes a sunset rum punch on the beach

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny must tackle nearly 40 high-rope obstacles and collect a set of Dare Master flags to avoid a messy forfeit.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Cornea invites Lloyd and his family to dinner, but they can't stomach Cornea's unique cooking and adopt a series of bizarre ways to try and avoid eating the food without offending their host.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to compete with Berry and prove that he's 'more caring' by rescuing flies whether they want or need rescuing or not - however, his zealousness backfires when he attempts a daring rescue 'outside'!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A comet brought into Earth's orbit ends up veering off-course, forcing International Rescue to step in to stop it colliding with the planet - and a space station

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. With the heroes' team in disarray, Monkie Kid and Ne Zha try desperately to stop the Monkey King from confronting the Lady Bone Demon on his own. Mei learns how to control the Samadhi Fire with Red Son, but when Monkie Kid catches up to the Monkey King, it seems that his mentor might actually stand a chance of defeating her!

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The Lady Bone Demon successfully overcomes the Monkey King and now has the perfect champion to complete her 'destiny' - Monkie Kid reunites with Mei and Red Son, but before they can come up with a plan, the corrupted Monkey King arrives to take Mei and the Samadhi Fire to his new master. Now Monkie Kid and the heroes will need to fight their strongest opponent ever...

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 1.30 Betfred Derby, plus a support race at 12.50. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Johnny Murtagh, and reports by Rishi Persad, Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Mick Fitzgerald, while Chris Hughes, Mark Heyes and Charlotte Hawkins cover events away from the racecourse. Betting news with Brian Gleeson, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Live FA Cup Football
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the showpiece match between the rivals at Wembley Stadium. City have already secured the Premier League title and are now looking to complete a treble by lifting both this trophy and the UEFA Champions League next week. However, United will relish preventing their neighbours from emulating their 1999 achievement and have also won silverware themselves this term, having lifted the Carabao Cup in February. With analysis from Roy Keane, Joleon Lescott, Ian Wright, Laura Woods and Karen Carney, commentary by Sam Matterface, Lee Dixon and Ally McCoist, and reports from Gabriel Clarke and Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Two more of the most thrilling and nerve-racking endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars
programme.desc: A special compilation episode of Deep Fake Neighbour Wars - the show that uses Deep Fake technology to turn the UK's best new impressionists into the world's most famous celebrities - only here they are ordinary people who happen to be embroiled in petty neighbour disputes. programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The father and son duo's road trip takes them to Nicaragua, where they meet some colourful characters in the local market, and get a taste of the national sport when they join a professional baseball team. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is cross when Berry brings his parents fruit fresh from the fridge - if anyone's going to raid the fridge, it should be him! Lloyd and Abacus therefore head to the fridge with Berry as their guide, but they find themselves unprepared for the cold...

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Scott comes to the aid of a mysterious aerialist whose hot-air balloon has crashed at the summit of a mountain

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is convinced that her mother would be very disappointed if they didn't participate in the town's Familimbo together. But they are both stiffer than wooden planks! To avoid a guaranteed humiliation, Sam asks for the power of elasticity. Unfortunately for her, while her body does stretch and twist in impossible ways... it doesn't snap back to its initial shape. So off Sam goes on her crazy mollusc-like adventure to find Mo...

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo dreams of joining the highly selective Robotics Club, but in order to do that, he needs to crack a particularly tough puzzle: he must assemble the three pieces that make up the club badge. He therefore asks the Spectral Scepter for the power of super glue. It works like a charm... too much so in fact: it's impossible to unglue anything from his body...!

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A crackdown on an organised crime racket leads Foyle and Milner to a shipyard owned by the Talbot brothers, a duo with dubious links to a communist agitator who has recently moved to the area. Peter Capaldi guest stars in the wartime drama, with Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: American GIs arrive in Hastings to a mixed welcome and Foyle is called on to calm the locals. But his attempts at soothing relations are jeopardised when a barmaid's involvement with a visiting soldier results in murder, leading the detective to defy orders to keep the peace and solve the case. Wartime crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell, Honeysuckle Weeks and Keith Barron

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: A local woman is killed when an experiment in biological warfare goes tragically wrong. Sam also falls victim to a potentially fatal illness as a result of the project. Foyle is forced to head into the most secretive and dangerous areas of wartime research, unearthing secrets that cannot be revealed even to the prime minister. Michael Kitchen stars, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Philip Franks

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby reluctantly joins wife Joyce on a spa weekend at Swavely Manor, a country house offering treatments to soothe the mind and body. However, as he attempts to unwind, a woman is found dead in a flotation chamber and he promptly abandons his therapy to investigate - but the body count soon rises. The detective eventually wraps up the case, but it proves to be his last as he makes a big decision about his future. John Nettles' final appearance in the long-running series, with guest stars Ronni Ancona, Geraldine James and Lesley Manville

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: The Dutch detective is called in to investigate the gruesome murder of Susie de Windt, a solicitor whose mutilated body was discovered strung up on a windfarm with an 'X' carved into her stomach and a cryptic note inside her coat. He discovers that days previously, she had won a case on behalf of the city to evict a group of artist squatters, and the windfarm where her body was discovered was where they were due to be relocated.

programme.desc: Suzy gives Stan food from the canteen to take home - but it's stolen property. When Blakey discovers that Stan and Jack are biting the hand that feeds them, he vows to make trouble. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney and Stephen Lewis

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates' novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Part two of two. Taxman Charley decides to escape from the office and go strawberry-picking with Mariette and the rest of the Larkin family - a move that leaves his career hanging in the balance. Light-hearted drama based on the novels by HE Bates, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris, Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lives are put on the line as Mike and Jackie receive orders to provide a refuge for a dangerous police informant, and David is left in charge of Greengrass's house while the old rogue is living it up in the Caribbean _ but does not count on an unexpected visitor making himself at home. Drama, starring Fiona Dolman, Jason Durr and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock is smitten by the charms of newcomer Susan Finlay, only to face a quandary when her son is charged with dangerous driving. Elsewhere, PC Bellamy rashly turns to the casino table and Vernon inadvertently causes chaos on a bride's big day. Starring Philip Franks, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn breaks down, finally admitting she should never have married Terry. Katie grows suspicious of Debbie and Emily is on to Eddie

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Nicola takes a shine to one of Viv's new suppliers and Rodney's business really takes off, but Eddie's scam is discovered

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Deirdre worries she won't have a job to go back to now that Dev knows their affair is out in the open, Richard keeps his eyes on Emily and Ade tries to get round Sarah

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A new plan starts to formulate in Richard's mind after he discovers Emily will be alone during the party in the Rovers

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The detective's god-daughter Lydia and her son James - who is severely traumatised by a bombing at his school - come to stay unexpectedly. Struggling to look after the lad when his mother goes missing, Foyle's life suffers a further complication when the body of a local man is found near a military centre - leading him into the top-secret world of weapons research. Kate Fleetwood and Michael Jayston guest star, with Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie prosecutes her mother's friend for negligence in the workplace, and Blaketon expresses his disapproval of Bellamy's relationship with Gina in no uncertain terms. Vernon and David turn their talents to the celebrity catering industry - with spectacular results. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman, Michelle Holmes and Susan Jameson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly farmer's widow seems to be the victim of a hate campaign, and the police race to uncover the culprit as events take a more serious turn. Vernon Scripps burns rubber to win a bet, enlisting Bernie's help in creating a hot-rod to rival the competition, and Ventress wonders if he should inform Bellamy after seeing Gina leaving the maternity ward. Drama, starring Jean Alexander and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As the sleuth studies for his forthcoming sergeant's exam, he investigates a hit-and-run that claimed the life of an eminent Oxford professor. The victim had been at odds with his peers over the fate of a potentially lucrative parcel of college-owned land, and the case is complicated by the appearance of DI Thursday's old gangland enemy - whom he must face alone while Endeavour makes a trip back to Lincolnshire to visit his ailing father

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: A gangland killing takes a surprising twist when it turns out the victim has been sexually mutilated. Andy punishes Janet by keeping her out of the heart of the investigation, and when she rebels, the ensuing row becomes personal. Rachel feels ambushed by Sean, who announces his mother wants to meet her - especially as she has spent years trying not to think about her own mum. Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Sean Maguire and Nicholas Gleaves star

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel discovers Nick has been brutally assaulted - and she is top of the list of suspects. But even worse, she has no recollection of the previous night after a drunken hen party, and struggles to convince herself she did not do it. Janet thinks she has made her peace with Andy, until he gives her some misinformation that results in Gill missing an appointment with the coroner - so the DCI, tired of their games, announces one of them will have to go. A man's accidental death turns into a murder investigation when his daughters reveal their mother often talked of killing him. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May

Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: World Series of Darts
programme.desc: Action from day one at Madison Square Garden in New York, featuring the first-round matches, as eight seeded players took on competitors from North America. Eventual champion Michael Smith prevailed 6-3 against Doug Boehm at this stage last year, while Leonard Gates was the one unseeded player to progress after overcoming Fallon Sherrock 6-2. The other players to make it through were Peter Wright, Gary Anderson, Gerwyn Price, Jonny Clayton, Michael van Gerwen and James Wade. Commentary comes from Stuart Pyke, Dan Dawson and Mark Webster

programme.title: The Car Years
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson and Alex Riley are tasked with championing the best car to mobilise the world after World War 2 to be released in 1948. programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Steve Rider presents coverage of all three races from the fourth meeting of the season, held at Thruxton in Hampshire. Commentary comes from David Addison, Tim Harvey, Richard John Neil and Paul O'Neill, with Louise Goodman reporting

programme.title: Isle of Man TT

programme.desc: A spaceship crashes on a desolate alien planet inhabited by nocturnal predators. The creatures' fear of light seems to guarantee the survivors' safety - but when an eclipse takes place, they face a desperate struggle to survive. Their only hope lies with a convicted murderer, who is equally at home in the darkness - but is far from trustworthy. Sci-fi horror, starring Vin Diesel and Radha Mitchell

Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar is called in to help a Russian physicist who wants to defect to America. Vintage adventure, starring Roger Moore, with Guy Deghy, Anthony Booth and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An elderly widow enlists Holmes' help to ascertain why a mystery purchaser should want to buy not just her house, but also all its contents. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke and Peter Wyngarde

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detectives fear for their lives when an old army friend reveals that a Russian agent who tortured them in Vietnam is determined to finish the job

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon Templar encounters a deadly lady with a gun and an attitude - and soon finds himself caught in the middle of an all-out revolution. Starring Roger Moore

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A man dies suddenly of a mysterious fever and Holmes suspects murder, but a malign influence takes its toll on the detective as he delves into the underworld of London's docklands. Starring Jeremy Brett, with Roy Hudd

programme.title: Isle of Man TT
programme.desc: Action from the opening sidecar race, as the riders took on the mountain course in the three-wheeled vehicles, with Ben and Tom Birchall looking to continue their unbeaten run

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A team of investigators from the mainland tracks down a stolen Tiki idol to the Masters' estate where it is on sale as part of a charity auction - but the valued treasure carries a sinister curse. Morgan Fairchild guest stars, with Tom Selleck and Roger E Mosley

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle are assigned to prompt Arab cultural attache and assassin Rahad into carrying out a murderous deed, in the hope they can catch him red-handed just before he commits the act and force him out of the country. Comedy actor John Junkin guests stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur persuades a reluctant Terry to make a comeback in the boxing ring to take on Jackie Wilson, the opponent he faced prior to losing his licence. However, Wilson's wife soon appears claiming her husband is unable to fight. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Giant Lobster Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Bryce fishes in his mate's hunting ground in a final sink-or-swim play to turn his fortunes around. Elsewhere, Squizzy faces a massive bill to fix his boat, while the Jager Brothers up the ante with a dingy challenge that backfires

programme.title: World of Sport
programme.desc: Richard Henwood takes a look back at The Indoor League. A show featuring 1970s pub games, presented by Yorkshire cricketing great Fred Trueman.

programme.title: Cycling: Criterium du Dauphine Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage two, featuring a 167.5km route from Brassac-les-Mines to La Chaise-Dieu. The finish laps featured a short but sharp ascent that could have created some gaps among the contenders. Gary Imlach presents, with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar, and reports from Daniel Friebe

programme.title: Isle of Man TT
programme.desc: A look at the impact of the FHO Racing team, which went unbeaten in the Superstock and Superbike classes on their TT debut in 2022

programme.title: Isle of Man TT
programme.desc: Action from the opening Superbike race, which saw 200mph bikes tackle the 37-mile mountain course six times in the longest and fastest road race in the world

programme.title: No Room for Error
programme.desc: Unrivalled behind-the-scenes access to the riders who take on the Isle of Man TT races

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In the heart of Central America lurks a marine creature believed to reach 8ft in length and weigh up to 300lbs. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is taken to breaking point as he re-evaluates everything he knows about fishing in an attempt to catch this monster - which is known to leap into boats and cause fatal injuries

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: On the Canada-US border lies a vast lake that hides a dark history. For Native Americans it's an ancient and sacred site, but recently something has risen up from the depths to attack swimmers, and stories abound of an invasion of primordial bloodsuckers. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade plunges into the heart of a waterfall in the Pacific Northwest on a mission to catch the oldest river monster of his career

Charles Leclerc of Ferrari qualified fastest here last year, with Red Bull's Max Verstappen joining him at the front of the grid. Lee McKenzie presents, with analysis from David Coulthard, Mark Webber, Billy Monger and Ariana Bravo

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: The historian takes a train journey across the world's oldest and greatest civilisation, starting at the very end of the Ancient Egyptian empire in Alexandria, before heading south to Cairo, Luxor and Aswan. Alice goes deep underground in search of Cleopatra, discovers how the Romans and the Greeks reacted to the treasures of Ancient Egypt and, on a visit to the site of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, she learns how a slave became a sultan and built his own fairy-tale caste

programme.title: Bad Boys (1995)
programme.desc: Detectives Mike Lowrey and Marcus Burnett search for a $100million heroin consignment brazenly stolen by a French drug kingpin from the police evidence room. However, after a mix-up over a phone call from a potential witness, each cop has to assume the other's identity - Lowrey becoming the henpecked family man and Burnett the playboy. Michael Bay's action thriller, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo and Theresa Randle

programme.title: The Last Stand (2013)
programme.desc: Disgraced narcotics cop Ray Owens retires into a quiet life as sheriff of a small town on the Mexican border. He gets the chance to prove his worth as a law enforcer when a drug lord escapes from prison and tries to flee the US - with his escape route taking him through Ray's jurisdiction. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Johnny Knoxville and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Olde Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Ethan may have found a way to make all of Sienna's dreams come true. Felix and Warren cannot see eye to eye, and Imran puts his best friend first

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Surrey, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole unearth some classic Danish furniture and make an unexpected profit for its owner

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: Springtime is a time of new life - it's a time where the Dales and the Lakes flourish. In Grasmere, sheep farmers Peter and Robert Bland are marking up their new lambs, before setting them and their mothers free on the open fell. On the Castle Bolton Estate in the Dales, head gamekeeper Ian Sleightholm and his children offer a hand to licenced bird ringer David Baines, as they capture and ring chicks no longer so common across the country. Because of Ian's management of the moor, species such as the lapwing, curlew and merlin have found a haven. In Wensleydale, a private woodland has become a sanctuary for another rare British breed - the red squirrel

programme.desc: Four tales celebrating the festive season. programme.title: The Simpsons

On the Swinton Estate in lower Wensleydale, bee farmers John and Michael Worsdale make the most of the warmer months

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The medics explore the theory that a 'broken heart' can cause patients to suffer very real mental and physical problems. Dr Wyne chats to Adolphus, who is struggling to come to terms with the recent death of his wife and best friend within a few weeks of each other. Dr Qamar pays a home visit to Elsie, a sprightly octogenarian whose health has deteriorated since the death of her husband, while Dr Razak treats young Emily, who has inherited a rare genetic condition from her late father which weakens the muscles of the heart

programme.title: Thomas & Friends

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon (2010)
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: Home Alone (1990)
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine O'Hara and John Candy

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon (2011)
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

programme.title: Let Him Go (2020)
programme.desc: Retired sheriff George Blackledge and his horse trainer wife Margaret live on a ranch in 1960s Montana, with their son James, his wife Lorna and their son Jimmy. A freak riding accident takes James' life, and the Blackledges watch helplessly as Lorna eventually marries Donnie, who communicates with his fists. Without warning, Donnie spirits Lorna and three-year-old Jimmy away to his family home in North Dakota. Crime drama, starring Diane Lane, Kevin Costner and Kayli Carter

programme.title: The Empty Man (2020)
programme.desc: When an ex-cop is trailing a missing girl, he comes across a secret group attempting to summon a terrifying supernatural entity. Mystery horror, starring James Badge Dale, Marin Ireland, Sasha Frolova, Samantha Logan and Virginia Kull

programme.title: #Horror (2015)
programme.desc: Six pre-adolescent girls face a night of terror when an online social media game goes horrifyingly wrong, turning a moment of cyber-bullying into a night of insanity. Crime horror, starring Emma Adler, Jessica Blank and Ted Christensen

programme.title: The Great Escape (1963)
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014)
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots are driven into hiding when the human race turns against them. When rediscovered by a kindly inventor and his daughter, they come out of exile to save the world, battling a new breed of human-created Transformers. These deadly new machines were created to hunt them down, but are now growing independent and intend to make use of technology from the Transformers' home planet in a plot that could threaten all life on Earth. Fourth film in the sci-fi adventure series, starring Mark Wahlberg, Stanley Tucci and Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Film4 Interview Programmes
programme.desc: Stars and directors talk about the experience of making movies in this compendium of personal and practical reflections

programme.title: Transformers: The Last Knight (2017)
programme.desc: The shape-changing robots and their human allies face a confrontation with their original creator, who has brainwashed their leader and intends to save her own home planet by destroying Earth. To save the human race they must recover an ancient artefact from Arthurian legend - but their mission is threatened by old enemies as they uncover a terrible secret about the history of the world. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mark Wahlberg, Anthony Hopkins, Gemma Chan, Stanley Tucci and John Turturro

programme.title: Bloodshot (2020)
programme.desc: Marine Ray Garrison is shot dead during a mission but regains consciousness in Kuala Lumpur in the care of Dr Emil Harting. The medic brought Ray back to life using nanotechnology, augmenting the Marine's strength, agility, speed and healing capabilities on the battlefield. Rechristened Bloodshot, Garrison wages top-secret war alongside other enhanced killing machines, while piecing together a conspiracy that robbed him of the woman he loved. Sci-fi thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Eiza Gonzalez and Guy Pearce

programme.title: Black Rain (1989)
programme.desc: Two New York cops arrest a hitman working for the Japanese Mafia, and are ordered to extradite him back to Osaka to stand trial. However, the prisoner gives them the slip on arrival, and as the detectives hunt him down with the aid of local law enforcement officers they become snared in a vicious gang war. Ridley Scott's thriller, starring Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia, Ken Takakura and Yasaku Matsuda

programme.title: Woman at War (2018)
programme.desc: An Icelandic environmental activist single-handedly fights a campaign of illegal sabotage against the aluminium industry. Her priorities shift when her application to adopt a Ukrainian orphan is accepted, leaving her struggling to balance the future of the Earth with the immediate needs of her child. Comedy drama, starring Halldóra Geirharðsdóttir and Jóhann Sigurðarson. In Icelandic, English, Ukrainian, Chinese and Spanish

programme.title: You, Me, Garden?
programme.desc: Clara and the team visit Raji's garden in Enfield, North London. Raji is deaf-blind, with limited vision and struggles to walk around her garden safely in its current state

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass (1967)
programme.desc: A cavalry captain sets out to deliver a shipment of rifles to a fort besieged by marauding Apaches, but the mission is undermined by a villainous corporal who plans to steal the weapons and sell them to the enemy. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Michael Burns, Laraine Stephens, Kenneth Tobey and Michael Keep

programme.title: Santa Fe Passage (1955)
programme.desc: A wagon scout accused of collusion with Apaches is given a chance to redeem himself when he is hired to transport a shipment of arms to Santa Fe. The owner of the valuable freight happens to be a mixed-race woman and at first he shows her only disrespect, but has to overcome his prejudice when he finds himself falling for her. Western adventure, with John Payne, Faith Domergue and Slim Pickens

programme.title: Pimpernel Smith (1941)
programme.desc: An unassuming English professor working on an archaeological dig in Germany leads a double life helping enemies of the Nazi regime escape the country. Second World War adventure based on The Scarlet Pimpernel, directed by and starring Leslie Howard, with Francis L Sullivan, Mary Morris, Hugh McDermott, Raymond Huntley and Manning Whiley

programme.title: Night Passage (1957)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3 (2017)
programme.desc: Following their win at the world championship, the now-separated Bellas (an all-female a cappella singing group) reunite for one last singing competition at an overseas USO tour. However, they face a squad who uses both instruments and voices. Final part of the blockbusting comedy trilogy, starring Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson and Brittany Snow

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off (1986)
programme.desc: A teenager plays truant from school and spends the day dragging his girlfriend and a reluctant friend into all manner of crazy adventures in the big city - while the school's dean of students vows to stop at nothing to prove the youngster is faking illness. Comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Mia Sara, Alan Ruck, Jennifer Grey, Jeffrey Jones and Charlie Sheen

programme.title: Bad Teacher (2011)
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. A wealthy substitute seems like a suitable candidate, but she has a rival for his attention in a squeaky-clean colleague. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Justin Timberlake, Jason Segel and Lucy Punch

programme.title: Animals (2019)
programme.desc: Two close friends find their hedonistic relationship threatened by impending nuptials. Director Sophie Hyde's comedy, adapted by Emma Jane Unsworth from her semi-autobiographical novel, starring Holliday Grainger and Alia Shawkat

programme.desc: Christmas has arrived, providing a typically chaotic time for the Pritchett-Dunphys, as Jay takes Manny to chop down a tree, Mitchell rushes to finish his shopping and Cam and Lily get into the holiday spirit at a charity event. Meanwhile, Gloria has a visit from her mum. Directed by Breaking Bad star Bryan Cranston

Using the plastic building bricks, the teams must create a sculpture that not only looks like the funnyman, but also express his personality. And he'll be the one to judge who's captured him the best. Contestants must also create a playable, life-sized arcade game. Presenter Melvin Odoom and judges Matthew Ashton and Fran Scott will be testing each entry for actual playability

programme.desc: Groom-to-be Craig decides to plan an Oktoberfest-themed wedding, but his uncompromising fiancee Sofia dreams of a boho beach wedding day

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil, Jay and Luke wage war against three generations of Thorpes, including Phil's arch- rival Gil. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is mightily annoyed after organising the school's most successful fundraiser, only for Spanish teacher Senor Kaplan to steal his thunder. Husband-to-be Mitchell, on the other hand, can't make up his mind about his old college pal Wendy, who is now his new boss, and Phil wants to impress daughter Haley, who has agreed to accompany him to the annual real estate banquet

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: A day at the museum proves to be anything but fun when Cam, Mitch and Manny realise they can't hold their own against brainbox Alex. Claire is less than enthusiastic when she and Gloria go shopping to buy a dress for Lily, while Jay imparts some manly pearls of wisdom to grandson Luke

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The adults take a trip to Las Vegas, where Jay wheels and deals to get them some better rooms - including their very own British butler, played by Stephen Merchant. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: When Barry Kripke finds proof that Dr Pemberton plagiarised his thesis in college, Sheldon and Amy aren't sure whether they should turn their rival in or not. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Karl and Naomh, who first met at university, love the relaxed lifestyle of Menorca and want to be near the beautiful beaches of its south-east coast where they held their wedding. With Scarlette Douglas on hand and a top cash budget of £230,000, they are looking for a place with plenty of outside space for themselves and their two dogs

programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the Home Counties with Harvie and Ranjit, who have had one of the longest searches she has ever tried to crack. With a staggering £1.6m budget, it seems like it should be simple but the couple confess to having viewed and rejected nearly 100 properties. Phil Spencer has a challenge of a different sort. Zosia and David have saved hard for their first home and have been living Zosia's parents while they search. They have their hearts set on the popular town of Hitchin and Phil thinks that might be partly why their £380,000 remains unspent

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. Kirstie is with Laura and Euan, who have recently returned to their native Glasgow from Sydney. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. Phil has a wide brief with Miriam and David, who have spent eight months searching for their new home. He soon has success - the only problem is, they have each fallen for a different house

programme.desc: Dairy farmer's wife and Disney enthusiast Charlene Fry-Henderson hosts the first dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes that her locally reared meat, home cooking, and entertainment involving a plastic cow will secure her the £1,000 prize. Her guests are local radio presenter Tommy Jardine, banker Olive Melville, prison custody officer Tammy Rice and trainee teacher Josh Jones

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast and banker Olive Melville hosts the second dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, where she hopes to impress her guests with a crab starter and mousse dessert - but things take a turn for the worse when a conversation about the royal family divides the diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Local radio DJ Tommy Jardine hosts the third dinner party in Dumfries and Galloway, and prepares chicken stuffed with haggis - but first he must continue a family tradition and rustle up a sheep for his entertainment. Tommy then tries to impress his guests with a touch of celebrity name-dropping, but young dance DJ and trainee teacher Josh trumps him at his own game

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee teacher and club DJ Josh Jones hosts the fourth night in Dumfries and Galloway, and hopes he can broaden his fellow contestants' palates with his menu of Indian food. He plans lamb pasanda and tandoori monkfish, but Tammy Rice finds something in her glass that wasn't on the menu. However, Josh hopes his disco entertainment might impress the guests enough to bag him the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tammy Rice hosts the final evening in Dumfries and Galloway, hoping to win the £1,000 prize with her no-nonsense approach and traditional Scottish fare. The dinner-party novice rustles up chorizo and cous cous stuffed peppers for her starter and incorporates haggis into her chicken-based main course

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Shiralee Bed & Breakfast in Salisbury, run by Fay Lahiani and her partner Ray Cooper, where some guests are shocked by the colourful and cluttered decor, while the presence of CCTV cameras also causes concern

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At The Bluebell Woods in Northampton, David and Donna Bletsoe Brown try to bring a touch of class to their woodland B&B, but Fay Lahiani and Ray Cooper are on the warpath and are quick to discover a mucky mattress. Meanwhile, Marc Harris and Wayne Williams reveal their competitive streak during an afternoon of horse riding

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lion Hotel in Pontypool for the third day of the contest, where manager Marc Harris and head chef Wayne Williams aim to deliver a high end service. Although some of the guests are impressed by the rooms, Ray and Fay find it too small for the price, and simmering tensions between some of the competitors leads to a clash over dinner. At breakfast, Wayne's food comes under fire, but it is David and Donna's feedback about finding a nail in their room that really rattles their hosts

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is the New Inn, Talgarth, where ex-naval officer Damon Lewis is the sole captain of his ship. Wayne and Marc are determined to be brutally honest, and Donna and David are forced to work closely with their rivals Fay and Ray during an afternoon team-building exercise. Over dinner, Damon admits that taking on the B&B, pub and restaurant all by himself may have not been the best decision - as proved when he has trouble running a solo breakfast service

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, with Fay and Ray from Shiralee B&B wanting to find out why David and Donna were so critical of their cleanliness. The group members continue to air their grievances as they find out what they've been paid, before the winner is revealed

programme.title: Great British Dog Walks with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: Phil is joined by Paralympic sprinter Libby Clegg and her guide dogs Hatti and Bramble. The pair walk with their pooches through the Yorkshire Dales while Libby shares her story and Phil learns how Hatti helps the Paralympian live fearlessly

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras reveal how individuals adapt and survive in the face of adversity. Subjects include Paul, 60, who is rushed to A&E after colliding with a van. Doctors are concerned that he may have serious injuries to his pelvis and spine. There's also a profile of four-year-old Jeremy, who is struggling to breathe. He suffers from a series of chronic conditions, including microcephaly and epilepsy

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at south-west London's St George's hospital on Harry and Meghan's wedding day in May 2018. As the happy couple tie the knot, patients and their relatives reflect on the meaning of lifelong love, devotion and commitment. Among those treated are David, 74, who is flown to St George's by air ambulance after falling from a ladder. Medics suspect internal bleeding and he is rushed to CT to assess the damage. His wife Lynda makes her way to the hospital as doctors try to prevent catastrophic blood loss

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Michelle Wolf take on guest captain Jonathan Ross with Johnny Vegas. Three-man comedy act Pappy's joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Jon Richardson and James Acaster teaming up against Lee Mack and Sarah Millican. John Cooper Clarke is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras reveal how individuals adapt and survive in the face of adversity. Subjects include Paul, 60, who is rushed to A&E after colliding with a van. Doctors are concerned that he may have serious injuries to his pelvis and spine. There's also a profile of four-year-old Jeremy, who is struggling to breathe. He suffers from a series of chronic conditions, including microcephaly and epilepsy

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow patients at south-west London's St George's hospital on Harry and Meghan's wedding day in May 2018. As the happy couple tie the knot, patients and their relatives reflect on the meaning of lifelong love, devotion and commitment. Among those treated are David, 74, who is flown to St George's by air ambulance after falling from a ladder. Medics suspect internal bleeding and he is rushed to CT to assess the damage. His wife Lynda makes her way to the hospital as doctors try to prevent catastrophic blood loss

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Software engineer Andy Forsyth and his partner Jacqui have three children between them and have decided the time is right to follow their dream and buy a second home on the Caribbean island of Barbados. Danni Menzies lines up five potential properties for them to choose between

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Tim, who plans to make a barn out of discarded windows and old driftwood, and novice builder Mandy, who is creating a retirement home in a minivan for her and her cat. Also, George and Will Hardie finally finish their Victorian-inspired observatory

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George employs a leading architect to transform the 1970s home of Tony and Sarah in the Vale of Glamorgan. The couple want rid of the pebbledash facade, small windows and dated decor, to create a great family home on a relatively modest budget of £60,000. They receive some bespoke and cutting-edge input from commercial and residential architect Greg Blee, with a plan that will link their home to the landscape beyond, including a Shard-like extension

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: Events manager Mitch and kitchen designer Elliot recently bagged themselves a bargain home in Bromley, Kent, and wasted no time in gutting the interior. The only problem is, now they have no idea working out where everything should go and how to add style and proportion while sticking to their monochrome design throughout. Enter George Clarke to give them a few tips. The architect also pays a visit to a workshop where bespoke antique mirrors are made. But will he be able to achieve a distressed effect without getting too distressed himself?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Divorce lawyer Michelle Camacho hosts the first dinner party in south London, where she hopes that her 1970s menu of duck a l'orange and coleslaw, vegetables and a Bloody Mary sorbet for dessert will help to secure her the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pub manager and artist Matt Wren hosts the second evening in south London, but his dinner party is beset by disasters in the kitchen and arguing guests at the dinner table when Michelle and Licia have a spat. However, one of the five takes a liking to another of the contestants

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Licia Snow hosts the third party in south London, and hopes to impress her guests with rustic and homely touches during her laid-back evening. However, her relaxed and calm approach could be threatened when she clashes with Michelle at the dinner table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Raphael Steele hosts the fourth night in south London and hopes that his first-ever dinner party will be a success. He plans a Caribbean evening based on old family recipes featuring ackee, saltfish and curried goat, and organises steel drum music for entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swedish businesswoman Charlotte Sundberg hosts the final party in south London. Her tactics are to present a night full of schnapps, folk songs and classic cuisine from her Scandinavian homeland, which she hopes will help her scoop the cash prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Alston House in Cumbria, where owners Michael and Carole Allchorne are brimming with confidence, but Yvonne Copeland and Gail Wells are less than impressed with the decor. The guests are impressed with chef Michael's breakfast, but the hosts are left reeling by the criticisms levelled at their hotel during the feedback session

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Scotia House in Harrogate, where host Marie Lock is hoping her obsessive cleaning regime will give her the edge in the competition. In the rooms, both Michael and Carole and Yvonne and Gail find the deluxe teddy bears freaky, and for Billy and Billy, things are a little on the cosy side. In the afternoon, Marie's keen to show off her moves and pits her guests against each other in a Northern Soul dance off

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Canberra Guest House in Blackpool for the third day of the competition, where host Yvonne Copeland, joined by her part-time helper Gail Wells, hopes her cheap and cheerful B&B will win over her guests. However, Marie finds what she thinks is urine and hair on the toilet seat in her room, and a lack of wi-fi means Billy Junior has to put his business on hold. Yvonne takes her competitors to a local reptile house, but serious divisions unfold within the group, and later, tensions rise again at dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Crown and Kitchen in East Linton, East Lothian, owned by father and son Billy and Billy Jr Robertson, who see themselves as the jokers of the pack. Yvonne and Gail leave no mattress unturned in their room inspection, although Michael and Carole are impressed. Later, Yvonne makes quite a splash when the hosts organise an assault course for their guests, but slow service during breakfast leaves the B&Bers disappointed - especially when Billy Jr is at a loss to explain what the problem was

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Things are tense from the start as Carole and Michael from Alston House challenge Marie on her comments. Next, Marie from Scotia House wants to set the record straight with allegations of tit-for-tat scoring. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee accountant Annika hosts the first dinner party in Boston, Lincolnshire, where she hopes to impress farmer's wife Carolyn, electrical engineer Adrian, carer Sylwia, and glamorous mum Katy with an evening modelled on a country fayre

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Competitions fanatic Katy hosts the second night in Boston, Lincolnshire, where she aims to impress her guests with her organisation skills and a menu featuring savoury profiteroles. However, fellow contestant Carolyn is critical of the food, and lone male host Adrian struggles to feel included when the conversation turns to hair extensions and fake eyelashes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the third night of the competition in Boston, Lincolnshire, Adrian hopes that his spicy food and surprises will help him scoop the £1,000 prize. Although he was quiet at the table the previous night, Adrian goes on the charm offensive and seems to be impressing his guests - but he may have gone a step too far with his final revelation

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Polish-born carer Sylwia hosts the fourth party of the competition in Boston, Lincolnshire, and hopes her European menu will charm her guests. However, the growing friction between diners Annika and Carolyn threatens to spoil the evening, and the host's chances of winning the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party night in Boston, and the hard-to-please foxhunter Carolyn is planning on using a charm offensive to win over the guests after having criticised each of them during the week. She has offended Annika, called Katy fake, found fault with Sylwia's food, and reprimanded Adie, but still believes she may be able to turn things around

programme.title: Chateau DIY: Living the Dream
programme.desc: Highlights of Tim and Rebecca's restoration of Château de la Ruche in the Pays de la Loire. They began by renovating suites to rent out, then moved on to a dilapidated outbuilding

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman falls getting off a bus and badly cuts her leg, and a pharmacist calls 999, worried that a child's rash could be a sign of meningitis. A holiday ends abruptly when a cut to a man's arm won't stop bleeding. A woman with cerebral palsy can't walk and needs medical help, and a man has a heart rate so low he could go into cardiac arrest at any moment

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr George's truck accident victim needs two tourniquets above the knee to stop severe blood loss, but if they don't come off he'll lose his leg. Dr Mya's special brand of TLC helps a young woman who's in physical and emotional pain.

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The heli-medics rush to help a man who has a single penetrating wound in his back, but who doesn't know if he's been shot or stabbed. Cyclist Thomas is knocked off his bike and the medics perform roadside surgery in a bid to save his life. Dean has been hit by a high-speed motorbike while changing a car tyre and remains remarkably calm while stuck under a wobbly vehicle

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: The hospital's surgical team are initially impressed with a charming young doctor, but his true character puts one of them in an awkward position

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

A holiday ends abruptly when a cut to a man's arm won't stop bleeding. A woman with cerebral palsy can't walk and needs medical help, and a man has a heart rate so low he could go into cardiac arrest at any moment
