Cyclist Thomas is knocked off his bike and the medics perform roadside surgery in a bid to save his life. Dean has been hit by a high-speed motorbike while changing a car tyre and remains remarkably calm while stuck under a wobbly vehicle

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Michelle and Gary Cole from Birmingham have both suffered from ill health over the past few years and have decided that the rejuvenating effects of the Spanish sun are just what the doctor ordered. They're looking for a holiday home where they and their two kids can spend quality time together. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties on the Costa Blanca for their £65,000 budget

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Teresa, who was born in Portugal but moved to the UK when she was five years old, find a holiday home in the Algarve to reconnect with her heritage

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A family from Derbyshire aim high with an eco-friendly glampsite, plans for a Spanish adventure golf course hit problems and a family launch a new farming business in Portugal

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items in Gloucestershire, including a rare pre-Second World War exercise bike and a huge set of farmyard scales used to weigh potatoes

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives unravel a mystery involving multiple surnames in a treasury case begun several years previously when a chance conversation with another family member uncovers a daughter and connects two estranged family members for the first time. Plus, the memorial service for a Liverpool MP leads probate detectives to a family who arrived in the city from Ireland at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the family of a reclusive printer, and in north London a team unlock the story of a sailor who stopped at nothing to fight for his country

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Newton House in Knaresborough, North Yorkshire, where Denise Carter and Jackie Fennell's traditional B&B focuses on organic, free-range breakfasts. Over dinner, guest Marianne Cammack and Deina Thomas from dominate the conversation, riling up some of the others, while Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson think the morning meal is all way too fancy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to the Highlands Pub in Blackpool, where managers Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson are all about value for money. However, Sean and Kathryn are horrified by what they find in their room, while Marianne and Deina think that theirs needs the female touch. In the afternoon the group competes in a basketball challenge at the amusement arcades, where the quiet hosts come out of their shells

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the White House in Brighton for the third day of the competition, where hosts Sean Edlin and Kathryn Turnbull run a laid-back seaside B&B. Denise and Jackie think the rooms are not well equipped and Marianne finds them clinical, while Mike and Neal are unsure about the price. Tensions are temporarily alleviated by a visit to the famous Theatre Royal, but Marianne and Deina continue to cause trouble at dinner. In the morning, a locally sourced breakfast impresses some of the guests, but the group must decide whether they are getting value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wakes Hall Lodges near Colchester is the fourth and final visit of the week, where Neal and Mike are wowed by the five-star self-catering accommodation, complete with hot tubs and lakeside views. The others aren't so sure about the 'luxury' breakfast hamper, however, especially as it means cooking their own. An afternoon of dog agility gives manager Marianne Cammack the chance to demonstrate her authority, although over dinner, her domineering conversation causes Jackie to finally snap

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Mike and Neal from the Highlands Pub challenge the comments that they were considered dirty and lacking in facilities, while Sean and Kathryn from the White House are left smarting after suffering large underpayments for what they think are minor issues. Eventually, the winner is finally revealed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Fresh from the success of hosting a three-day wedding at the chateau, Dick and Angel make business plans for the grounds, intending to charge people to fish in the moat and forage in the woods. Angel starts work on a second guest suite, but also wants to install an elevator, which pushes Dick's engineering skills to the limit

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Poodle cross Wally is struggling to find a forever home, having spent a year in the centre during which time he has had four unsuccessful attempts. But the staff remain confident someone will come along who is able to handle his tricky behaviour. Meanwhile, bichon frise Bruce is looking for a quiet home and a comfy lap. Will he find that with Janet from Sheffield, who wants a well-behaved dog to keep her company after the death of her husband?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Architect Patrick Bradley has come up with an unusual £100,000 house design built out of four 45ft shipping containers, welded together to form a giant cross and cantilevered over the top of a stream on the family farm in Co Derry. His mother is hoping the new home will help her son find a girlfriend, but the small budget and tight schedule soon pose problems. Kevin McCloud follows his progress

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz take on a 1992 Saab 900 Turbo, belonging to A former electrical engineer who has recently fallen ill

programme.title: How to Build
programme.desc: An access-all-areas visit to the Mini factory in Oxford, revealing the step-by-step process that goes into creating a Mini Electric, from the pressing of individual metal panels and the construction of its electric powertrain to the painting of the contrast roof

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Maulden, Yvonne collapses with a cardiac arrest. It's a race against the clock as the heli-medics try to help. In the Peaks, medics land on top of a steep ridge to rescue Donna, who has collapsed while walking. A motorcyclist collides with a car trying to avoid ducks crossing the road and medics fear multiple fractures

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow Aydigul, 38, who has suspected sepsis following major abdominal surgery. Her sister is at her bedside throughout, and discusses their childhood in Tajikistan and her extraordinary strength in the face of adversity. Plus, emergency consultant Ahmed rushes to save the life of a woman who has an abdominal aortic aneurysm

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.desc: How do you improve upon perfection? Custom car king Yianni Charalambous is challenged to create a new look for a million-pound Pagani Huayra

programme.desc: The chef visits the town of Madurai in Tamil Nadu, where he learns the art of temple cooking and samples south Indian dish sambar. He then takes a road trip across the Western Ghats to the state of Kerala, where he prepares regional dessert payasam and a traditional pork curry

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the hunters are off to Leeds, where a new pair of bidders arrive - and they are not afraid to throw their weight around. Meanwhile, Sam and Ione re-ignite their feud

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders looking for treasures in Ipswich. With Heavy D back in town the bargaining buccaneers are being driven mad by the booming bidder

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Auctioneer Sean Kelly and his bidders head to Broadstairs in Kent where there are some high quality goods up for auction, including a double car lot

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: The team heads to Preston, where Scotty feels entirely out of his element, but receives a warm welcome from an auctioneer. Meanwhile, Charlotte and Sam join forces

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer comes face to face with Ace, his double from another dimension, but finds the uncanny resemblance is purely physical. His counterpart is brave, successful, selfless and popular - everything Rimmer is not. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie and Craig Charles

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and the crew discover a device that offers a new way of travelling through space, and find themselves transported to a giant theme park whose inhabitants - waxwork droids modelled to resemble famous figures from fiction and history - are fighting among themselves. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Cameras follow old friends Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer as they embark on an angling trip round the UK. The first stop is Norfolk, and while fishing for tench, Bob tries to impress Paul with his childhood fishing rod - and fails. They share nostalgia for their younger years and reveal how they recently came face to face with their own mortality due to heart disease

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob fish for barbel in Hay-on-Wye, and sample the great outdoors in spectacular fashion when Mortimer decides to strip in celebration of their catch. Passing a graveyard, they muse about the future and chat to a local vicar about death and their own funerals. To lighten the mood, back in their wooden fishing cabin, Bob promises Paul a very special treat if they are successful with their angling efforts

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? Sally Bretton and Katy Wix also star

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A wealthy new couple move into the block and soon find out that sharing a building with Lee and Lucy is anything but straightforward. The fun begins when Lee somehow manages to bag an invitation to a christening party being thrown by the couple - sending him and Lucy on a last-minute gift-buying trip, during which they make every wrong decision humanly possible to find the perfect present for the baby who seems to have everything. Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden join the cast, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain. Ferrari's four-wheel-drive FF is pitted against the revised, V8-engined Bentley Continental GT on a test track at the edge of the Arctic Circle, while James puts the Fisker Karma through its paces in Florida, and meets AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to boost the British economy by embarking on a trade mission to India. programme.title: Building Cars: Secrets of the Assembly Line

James May, Kate Humble and Ant Anstead broadcast from inside Mini Plant Oxford, one of Britain's biggest and busiest car factories, where a new car drives off the production line every 68 seconds. James looks at the use of robotic technology and investigates the claim that British manufacturing is dead, while Ant explores the history and heritage of one of the most iconic cars ever built, and Kate reports on the use of electric cars in Norway

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to follow the route of the historic Irish mail service from Ledbury in Herefordshire to Holyhead on Anglesey. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Ledbury to Holyhead, taking the train to the summit of Wales' highest peak, Mount Snowdon. He then examines the revival of Anglesey's sea salt industry, before discovering how the railways transformed the port of Holyhead

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the next leg of his journey, travelling from Newcastle upon Tyne to Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire, along some of the earliest railways in England. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo falls into line with the University of Glasgow's Officer Training Corps, where he joins students for drill. The political pundit then heads west along the Firth of Clyde to Helensburgh, where he discovers a pioneering group of artists known as the Glasgow Boys. The idyllic West Highland Line takes Michael deep into the Highlands to Inveraray and the ancestral home of the Clan Campbell and Dukes of Argyll. Michael's final stop is Connel Ferry, near Oban, where, on the Achnacloich Estate, he discovers a Highland calf whose breed has become an icon of the Highlands

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the Bolton steeplejack's love of restoring engines and chimneys, highlighting one of his greatest triumphs - the steam traction engine he painstakingly repaired over 27 years. His great appreciation for volunteers who dedicated their lives to preserving the past is also explored

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to venture beyond Europe as he travels through the Holy Land. programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary exploring the story of the veteran porn star, who after 40 years in the adult movie industry, is now facing multiple charges of rape and sexual assault. The first episode focuses on his rise to fame in the 1970s, and examines how rumours of his crimes were circulating even then. Featuring personal testimony from British porn star Lianne Young, who says he assaulted her at a party in full view of other people

programme.title: Porn King: The Rise & Fall of Ron Jeremy
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary revealing how the porn star's alleged crimes were eventually brought to light. Having made his name as a porn star, Ron Jeremy now crossed over into the mainstream, making Hollywood friends, becoming a reality star and even selling his own range of rum. But when he is accused of molesting a 15-year-old girl, as well as a church-going, lifelong friend, police finally investigate

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Claire, 46, has been sent to A&E by her GP with chronic back pain, and doctors soon realise she may be suffering a serious underlying spinal injury. Anne Marie has been rushed to St George's following a suspected stroke, and staff have to act quickly to help prevent any long-lasting damage, while five-day-old Gracie is brought in by new parents Danny and Jordan, concerned she has an infected umbilical cord

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Canal boat stewardess Denise Hendon hosts the first dinner party in Birmingham. Despite admitting her cookery skills could be better, she hopes her night of Moroccan-themed revelry will be a success, but the guests are underwhelmed by her menu. While party girl Angela McFarlane dreads eating the couscous, suave Frenchman Jean-Benoit Burloux longs for a glass of fine wine to wash the meal down

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Cornwall take part in the culinary challenge, with the first hosts being competitive duo Marie and Gavin, who are more than happy to receive a glowing response from one of their fellow competitors. Next up are 25-year-old Becki and her 55-year-old partner Barry, whose age-gap romance leaves their guests with a lot of questions. Finally, Sam and Nick throw the last party, but their rivals are uneasy ahead of arriving at their home, since the pair spent much of their time during a previous engagement discussing their plans for surviving a zombie apocalypse

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Roberta Smithies from the Lake District in Cumbria hopes to wave goodbye to her childhood home and embrace a new life in Costa Rica. She has a budget of £200,000 and hopes Jonnie Irwin will find her a property with views that are impressive enough to tempt her to make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Nicholas and Pauline Patch, a couple who have frequently holidayed on Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands and are now looking for a second home there. Armed with a budget of £125,000, she shows them around a range of potential properties

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Gary and Annette plan their dream country home, while Dannie and Grace research activities for another new learning zone on their family farm

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Complete strangers paramedic Sarah and garment technologist Paige team up to transform a crumbling house bought at auction into a dream home. The tired Victorian terrace in Stafford, the West Midlands, is packed with original features and, armed with a budget, a six-month schedule and advice from Simon O'Brien, they seem the perfect team. But with money leaking like water from a broken pipe, will there be enough left to make a profit?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole finds a miniature Hay Wain to lovingly restore as he and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk and Constable Country

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in Essex and Suffolk, where the first host, 29-year-old entrepreneur Chris, plans to treat his guests - Samantha, Joanna, Mark and Claire - to a night of fine French cuisine, with the added bonus of ripped abs on display

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from Essex/Suffolk, and it is the turn of salon owner Sam to cook. She has opted for a good looking, simple menu, but foodie Chris is not impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Claire hosts the third night of the contest in Essex, and lays on a lavish East End-themed feast, but Sam may be looking for vengeance after everyone claimed her food was boring

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Essex sees Polish party girl Joanna offer a taste of her homeland in a bid to win the prize. But some of the unusual flavour combinations throw her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kim is looking for a holiday home on Spain's eastern Costa del Sol and she's brought her younger sister Debbie along to help. Both Kim and Debbie grew up by the sea in south Wales, so they desperately want their holiday home to be within a stone's throw of a beach. Leah Charles-King shows them what their £115,000 can get as she lines up five properties for them to visit

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: The historian takes a train journey across the world's oldest and greatest civilisation, starting at the very end of the Ancient Egyptian empire in Alexandria, before heading south to Cairo, Luxor and Aswan. Alice goes deep underground in search of Cleopatra, discovers how the Romans and the Greeks reacted to the treasures of Ancient Egypt and, on a visit to the site of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, she learns how a slave became a sultan and built his own fairy-tale caste

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including SAS: Who Dares Wins, Bridgerton, Freeze the Fear with Wim Hof, The 1% Club, Get Organized with the Home Edit, Made in Chelsea. Plus ITV news coverage of Rishi Sunak and the BBC's coverage of 'Partygate' fines

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The final episode finds Dara Ó Briain, Fern Brady, John Kearns, Munya Chawawa and Sarah Millican, continuing to vye to become the 14th Taskmaster champion, Greg Davies hosts, ably assisted by Alex Horne

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: The Aberdeen trauma team are dispatched by air to 52-year-old Mark, who is trapped after crashing and rolling his van into farmland. In Inverclyde, nine-year-old David has been thrown 50 yards off his quad bike and impaled onto a metal fence, while 59-year-old Jacqui is rushed to the Queen Elizabeth Major Trauma Centre with multiple injuries after her car fell 10 feet down an embankment

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
programme.desc: Documentary following a successful businesswoman who carries the weight of a childhood of repeated sexual abuse by her father. With his release from prison, Emily considers confronting the person who dominated her childhood as she seeks to find out if the time inside has changed him at all. She reaches out to those from her formative years - teachers, family friends, and her mother, trying to understand how her abuse remained and reconnects with the police officers who dealt with her case, hidden for so long

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who feels like she's going to pass out at work. As the paramedics arrive, they find her lying on the floor. A man needs morphine to combat the agony of kidney stones. A patient suffering with a painful hernia needs an operation, but due to the Covid-19 pandemic it's been postponed and now he's being constantly sick and can hardly move

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Guests Emily and Warren are big fans of their room's sea views, but Bis and Deep find a dirty kettle and Ann and Rebecca aren't happy about a dusty chandelier. Later, in the morning, there's a long wait at breakfast

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red

programme.title: When Luxury Cruising Goes Wrong

Dubbed the 'poop cruise', instead of sipping cocktails in the lap of luxury, they had to endure the stench of raw sewage backed-up on deck. Narrated by Glynis Barber

Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Anthony Andrews and Karen Austin

programme.title: Columbo

programme.title: Columbo

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Conrad and Philip Bruns

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.desc: Drama inspired by the classic 1983 mini-series about man's first encounter with an extraterrestrial race, updated and reimagined for a 21st-century audience. programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: Jason poses as a safecracker to investigate the bizarre case of a man who has been found dead wearing a spacesuit

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Cardigan Bay to Liverpool, visiting the heritage railway in Tywyn that was the inspiration for Thomas the Tank Engine and a community that is famous for knitting. She also paints a carriage in Boston Lodge, catches the famous Ffestiniog railway through Snowdonia, and visits Europe's fastest zip wire and largest pet cemetery

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professor Eunan O'Halpin investigates the struggle for Irish independence in the years after the end of the First World War, and the outbreak of civil war in 1922

programme.title: Planet Without Apes
programme.desc: Reporter Michel Abdollahi goes on a worldwide search to uncover illegal trade of great apes

programme.title: The Big Job (1965)
programme.desc: A trio of inept crooks try to retrieve a cache of stolen loot from its hiding place in the grounds of a police station. Crime comedy, starring Sid James and Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Paris Blues (1961)
programme.desc: Two talented blues musicians attempt to make their mark on the Parisian music scene - but complications get in the way as they encounter a bevy of beautiful fans. Romantic drama, starring Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, Sidney Poitier and Louis Armstrong

programme.title: Sky Pirates (1976)
programme.desc: Two boys are befriended by an ex-pilot and his niece, who teach them how to fly radio-controlled planes. When crooks steal one of the aircraft in an attempt to smuggle a stolen diamond across the Channel, the children embark on an ingenious plan to thwart them using radio controlled Spitfires loaded with darts. Children's adventure, starring Adam Richens and Michael McVey

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: A journey through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: First-hand accounts of the disaster that befell United Airlines Flight 232, which was making its way from Denver to Chicago in 1989 when the DC-10 aircraft suffered a catastrophic failure to the tail-engine

programme.title: Let Him Have It (1991)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial 1952 murder trial in which 19-year-old Derek Bentley was sentenced to be hanged for killing a policeman - even though his friend Chris Craig was the one who fired the fatal gunshot. Starring Christopher Eccleston, Paul Reynolds, Tom Courtenay, Eileen Atkins, Tom Bell and Mark McGann

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Orthodox (2015)
programme.desc: An Orthodox Jewish boy is bullied for his faith, and learns to box so he can fight back. When he pursues a career in the ring as an adult, it leaves him ostracised from his community. Desperate to support his family, he turns to crime, setting in motion a terrible chain of events that leave him more isolated than ever. Drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Smiley

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert heads to the Yorkshire Dales to explore the limestone geology of the dramatic pavements, cliffs and caves as well as the wildlife dependent upon it. He meets Ingleborough National Nature Reserve warden Colin Newlands, who introduces him to the extraordinary plant life of Scar Close, and squeezes down a gully in search of the cave spider. Ray teams up with researchers from the University of Leeds to survey the bat population and spends time observing the dipper - a small river bird able to walk underwater

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores Salisbury Plain in Wiltshire, home to Stonehenge and the largest army training area in the UK. He discovers an ancient invertebrate that depends on military manoeuvres to survive, and spots rare wildflowers in unlikely places as well as bird species, including the grey partridge, yellowhammer and corn bunting, that are in drastic decline elsewhere. Ray also meets David Waters, who has pioneered the reintroduction of the great bustard - the world's heaviest flying bird - after an absence of 180 years

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: Poh joins Andre on a food adventure sourcing some of South Australia's finest produce. Back home, Poh creates two brilliant new recipes - the ultimate beef pie and coffee éclairs

programme.title: Poh & Co
programme.desc: t's opening day at the Central Market Café and Poh, Jono, Matt and Sara are nervous and excited

programme.title: Seize the Day (1986)
programme.desc: An honest salesman fallen on hard times return to his New York roots and a reunion with his estranged father. Drama, starring Robin Williams and Glenne Headly

programme.title: The Hasty Heart (1949)
programme.desc: A belligerent Scottish soldier is hospitalised in Burma and takes out his anger on a fellow patient, unaware he has only weeks to live. Drama, starring Richard Todd, Patricia Neal, Ronald Reagan, Orlando Martins and Anthony Nicholls

programme.title: This Is My Street (1964)
programme.desc: A bored housewife has an affair with her mother's lodger, but is driven to suicidal despair when he rejects her. Drama, starring Ian Hendry and June Ritchie

programme.title: Lost Lagoon (1957)
programme.desc: A man lost at sea in a tropical storm ends up stuck on a desert island with a strange woman, and decides to let the rest of the world think he is dead so they can start a new life together. However, his plans are jeopardised when an insurance investigator comes looking for him. Drama, starring Jeffrey Lynn and Leila Barry

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Moonbase is attacked by strong electric waves from a mysterious nearby planet, so the Alphans resolve to convince its residents they pose no threat. Sci-fi drama, starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Nick Tate

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert takes a trip down the Wye, beginning in the Cambrian Mountains. He observes the mating behaviour of the sea lamprey and spots the varied birdlife along the river, including a colony of sand martins tending their young and all three species of British wagtail. He also meets Richard Davies, who has boosted water vole numbers in the area, and learns about Environment Agency scientist John Taylor's efforts to save the freshwater pearl mussel

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert is on the west coast of Scotland to explore one of the world's rarest habitats - temperate rainforest. He discovers the skittish sika deer and meets a lichenologist who shows him a wealth of species that thrive in Argyll's wet, humid climate. Ray also observes the nest of two ospreys and finds out why the reintroduction of the European beaver is benefiting other wildlife

programme.title: The Driver (1978)
programme.desc: A hard-bitten detective embroiled in a long-running investigation of a skilled criminal tries to outsmart the crook. Frustrated by his knack of fleeing the crime scene unscathed, the cop sets up a fake robbery in a bid to catch his man. Thriller, starring Ryan O'Neal, Bruce Dern, Isabelle Adjani, Ronee Blakley and Matt Clark

programme.title: The Maids (1975)
programme.desc: Two maids hate their employer, so whenever they are alone in the house, they indulge in a sexual roleplay fantasy in which they take turns dressing up as her, so the other can pretend to murder her. Drama based on Jean Genet's stage play, starring Glenda Jackson and Susannah York

programme.title: Song for a Raggy Boy (2003)
programme.desc: A widower is hired to teach at a strict Catholic reformatory school, but the harsh regime soon fires his anger, leading to a series of confrontations with the heavy-handed priests in charge of the establishment. Fact-based drama set in 1939, starring Aidan Quinn, Iain Glen, Marc Warren and Dudley Sutton

programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Six Queens of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Profile of the king's six wives, all formidable individuals. Ambitious, brave and ruthless, they shaped the King, and in turn, England itself

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims hatch a cunning plan to liberate the land of Codslow, ruled over by three evil immortals who depend on pearls, paper and wine to fuel their magical powers. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: San Demetrio London
programme.desc: The story of a British merchant ship in an Atlantic convoy in 1940 that was left disabled and at the mercy of patrolling U-boats. The crew must keep afloat and out of harm's way

programme.title: Lilies of the Field (1963)
programme.desc: Travelling handyman Homer Smith stops at a remote farm in the Arizona desert to get water when his car overheats, and encounter a group of German, Austrian and Hungarian. He agrees to repair a roof for them, but the mother superior has a bigger task in store for him. starring an Oscar-winning Sidney Poitier, with Francesca Jarvis, Lisa Mann and Isa Crino

programme.title: Otters and the Exotic Pet Trade
programme.desc: Tracking the exotic pet trade of otters across the globe, is a story of gangsters and guns, mammals and middlemen

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: The first episode of the classic 1970s comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter as a middle-aged executive stuck in a rut and eager to learn the real meaning of life. When Reginald Perrin set out for work on Tuesday morning, he had no intention of calling his mother-in-law a hippopotamus. But he did, and from then on everything began to change. Originally broadcast in 1976

programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: EFL Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Liverpool v Cardiff City. Action from the 20212 final at Wembley Stadium. The Reds had defeated the likes of Stoke City, Chelsea and Manchester City to reach the final and went into the match as clear favourites in their first visit to the national stadium since it was rebuilt. However, the Bluebirds, who defeated Crystal Palace on penalties in the semi-finals, had been in good form in the Championship and will have fancied their chances of producing an upset
